data.title: On the main drag; great bar food
data.text: The three guys manning the bar were going 90 miles an hour; scored bar stools late afternoon.  Had happy hour carnitos tacos and "mini" chimichangas.  More than enough for a meal.  Only downside was all the people hovering for a seat.  Bar food was 5-6 bucks.  Great deal.

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: Great food great service. The greeting with  fruit cocktail was impressive. Lots of parking in City lot behind.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: There are two locations.  One is on Park Street, and the one I enjoy is on Bay farm Island in the shopping center across from the library.  Good Mexican food.  I like to order a short order of tacos, enough to fill me up.  Try their super burrito or spicey shrimp dishes.  Good prices, great service.

data.title: Huevos rancheros
data.text:
Best huevos around in my opinion  
Served with rice and your choice of beans
If you like spicier salsa just ask they will bring it.
Huge tequilla selection and a great  HH.
.

data.title: Fantastic
data.text: I've been a frequent guest since 2003 when it was La Piñata. Menu is a bit huge! Salsa great, service generally great. 5 star rating for the category&expectation for a good Mexican meal. Great idea for weekend brunch while folks are lining up@Ole's across the street😊

data.title: Wow, great food!
data.text: This is a must if you like Mexican food, and are in Alameda! Great service, spectacular margaritas, and food that is unique and perfectly prepared! The fish meal I had was amazing. When I travel north from So. Cal. I will find a way to eat here again! Yummy!

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: Great reviews for this restaurant were right. The food was fantastic and must stop when in the area.

data.title: Great location, okay food
data.text: I'm not a fan of the menu. Mostly greasy food. The place is fancy and very nice looking. It's in a beautiful location. My complaint is about the food. A hair came out in my food. The waiter was nice about it and offered me more food.

data.title: Good Mexican food and drink
data.text: Margaritas were excellent.  I had a half order or tacos, which was plenty for me.  Jim had the full meal of enchiladas.  Food was good, service was efficient and accommodating.

data.title: Great spot!
data.text: We stopped by on the suggestion of a friend for street tacos, and I was incredibly impressed. They use excellent ingredients, and everything was authentic and completely delicious. We loved the Al Pastor tacos, the rice, and found the pickled carrots to be a lovely addition to our meal. We highly recommend this place!

data.title: Love, love,  love the street tacos
data.text: You must check out La Penca Azul, the food is awesome,  the staff is friendly and helpful and the tequila Is award winning. This is a fun spot for families and couples a like. It is really hopping Friday and Saturday nights.

data.title: Post A's game meal
data.text: This is one of my favorite Mexican spot so no complaints here! I typically get the Asada Super Burrito but today I'm going out on a limb by getting the Super Asada and Shrimp Burrito!

data.title: Too crowded and loud with sticky floor
data.text: While waiting for a table we were backed into the bar area for about 40 minutes.  There is no place to wait outside.  It's definitely a popular place but the food was not memorable and it's too loud with wait staff that seems worn out.  I have not interest in returning.

data.title: Great food and company
data.text: Great place to meetup with friends and family. Food was good but loud place not great for intimate encounters.

data.title: Authentic Mexican Food
data.text: Loved their chicken tacos. (see photo) Their mild salsa sauce and tortilla chips were addicting and freshly made. Loved their menu selection and colorful setting.

data.title: Big Portions!
data.text: My family & I had dinner at La Penca Azul a few days ago. The location is great. Sat next to a window that overlooked the lagoon. The portions are very big. My son ordered the quesadillas & they were so large that two people could eat that & fill up. My husband had the burrito & the same. Huge! The combinations are just right for one person. The food wasn't the best I've ever had, but flavorful. My husband & I ordered the classic margarita & weren't impressed. Just ok. The wait staff was very nice & had our food at our table rather quickly. Overall, nice place, large portions but the food was just ok.

data.title: Popping Mexican Restaurant
data.text:
We were there, a group of seven after midnight on a Friday.  Place packed, but still only took 15 minutes to get seated. Music, great atmosphere, really cool agave theme, hence name Penca Azul. Menu had fabulous choices, including favorites and intriguing specialties.  We had wonderful delicious
Burritos, which easily could feed two. Drinks awesome, also nice variety of premium Mexican beers.  Service very quick and helpful.  Incredible such good service even after midnight. Overall awesome experience, a must go to place.  Parking only challenge.

data.title: Good service
data.text: We went to have dinner.  I ordered fish.  The portion was large.  The atmosphere was noisy, so if you want a quiet dinner this is not the place to go. The chips/salsa were delicious.  The dinner plate portions were substantial but not flavorful.  The drinks were very good.  Parking is a challenge, but if you go after 6pm, you can park in the Bank of America lot.

data.title: Best Mexican Restaurant in Alameda
data.text:
We regularly eat at the Island Drive location of La Penca Azul, and it has, without a doubt, the best Mexican food in Alameda.  It's a bit pricey, but they make up for it in quality and quantity.  We've eaten at many Mexican restaurants over the years, and all of them in Alameda, and La Penca Azul's food is the best, and by far the best in Alameda, and with the biggest portions.  

Our experience is that service is always good, even on nights when the restaurant is busy.  We love the salsa and chips, and the waiters have never failed to keep the chip and salsa bowls full, even when we've been hungry and eaten multiple bowls before dinner. The house brand beer on tap is my wife's favorite. The soft drinks are repeatedly refilled, many times without asking.  The food comes out promptly after ordering. 

We highly recommend eating at this location, and if you're lucky, you might even run into one of the Golden State Warriors eating here after a game [check out the photos on the wall].

data.title: Decent food, parking was a challenge
data.text:
When visiting our daughter in CA, we spent some time driving around the Bay area and happened to be in downtown Alameda around lunchtime.  We passed by this restaurant and I dropped off my family as I sought to find some parking.  It took me about 15 minutes to find any parking, which happened to be in a lot on an adjacent street.

The service was quick and friendly.  The food was plentiful and tasted good.  The margaritas we ordered tasted quite odd so we sent them back for other selections.

If there was better parking, I could see going back there again.
